Hear from him next. if (window && window.foxstrike && Array.isArray(window.foxstrike.cmd)) { window.foxstrike.cmd.push(function(Strike) { Strike.insertAd('desktop', 'lb14', 'desktop-desk-ad-lb14', ''); }); } else { console.error('Error: window.foxstrike not found'); }

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: Just minutes ago, Michael Cohen leaving Capitol Hill after his third day of congressional testimony. He was meeting behind closed doors with the House Intelligence Committee. President Trump is firing back against his former attorney's claims in an interview airing on "Hannity" tonight.

utterances.speaker: TRUMP
utterances.sentences: As far as Cohen is concerned, he's convicted, he's a liar, he's defrauded at a high level. He's got a lot of problems. And you know, it was very interesting, because he lied so much. I watched some of it. I actually was able to watch some of it. He lied so much and yet he said when it came to collusion, the whole hoax with the Russia collusion, it's just a witch hunt hoax and very -- by the way, very, very bad for our country because it really stops you from doing what you set out to do. He said no collusion.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: So no collusion.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: That was the only part he didn't lie about. if (window && window.foxstrike && Array.isArray(window.foxstrike.cmd)) { window.foxstrike.cmd.push(function(Strike) { Strike.insertAd('desktop', 'lb15', 'desktop-desk-ad-lb15', ''); }); } else { console.error('Error: window.foxstrike not found'); }

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: That's right.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: That's what's hard about that argument.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.sentences: Very hard.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: Dana, if he did have the goods on collusion or anything like that, he probably wouldn't be going to jail. He probably would've cut a deal.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: Immunity. I guess, maybe. I mean, we don't know what's in the Mueller report, so I don't really know. I would ask two questions about the hearing. Did it move the Democrats closer to impeachment? No, I don't think so. I think that's pretty much consensus. No, no. Number two, does it change anyone's opinion about the character of Donald Trump? No. So, there –

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: Don't say nothing burger. Are you going to say this is nothing burger? if (window && window.foxstrike && Array.isArray(window.foxstrike.cmd)) { window.foxstrike.cmd.push(function(Strike) { Strike.insertAd('desktop', 'lb16', 'desktop-desk-ad-lb16', ''); }); } else { console.error('Error: window.foxstrike not found'); }

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: I'm not going to say nothing burger. I think it was a hearing that had to happen. I think it's now behind everybody. The only thing is I think that there might be an excuse for the Democrats to be able to say we need some more hearings. If you look at Congresswoman Ocasio-Cortez's questions about money laundering and the insurance claims and the way that she walked down that, she said, do you think we need to get more information on this and you need to see the tax returns. He says, yes --

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: So what exactly did she allege? That he was devaluing the property in order to day --

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: I don't know. This is what I think. I think somebody within maybe SDNY or somebody suggested that that would be a good question to ask and get him on the record because then it allows them to pull more strings. But again, I think that on the two big questions, the answer was no.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: OK. Greg Gutfeld?

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: I have to -- the best analysis came from Geraldo. He found more in Al Capone's vault than that.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Cohen in a way -- the only thing that strikes me. Obviously he's a rat but he exchanged his rat costume for a different rat costume yesterday. He is like Jussie Smollett. He knows the media's weakness. Smollett knew that a hate crime would get him somewhere. That was the currency. Cohen knew his currency was anti-Trump platitudes. He knows that it's the opiate for the media still hurting from 2016. if (window && window.foxstrike && Array.isArray(window.foxstrike.cmd)) { window.foxstrike.cmd.push(function(Strike) { Strike.insertAd('desktop', 'lb17', 'desktop-desk-ad-lb17', ''); }); } else { console.error('Error: window.foxstrike not found'); } So when he did that soliloquy yesterday, it was like he was running through everything you say at a cocktail party about Trump in case you got to say Trump. The media meanwhile is like going like this is huge, a bombshell, but it turned out to be more like a mild rash that was gone by the next day. No collusion, Cohen.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: The 24-hour flu.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Yes, it was, which I think I might have.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: Juan, do you agree with Dana's assessment that the Democrats are not any closer to impeachment after the Cohen hearing?

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.sentences: It was a funny one because I think Dana laid out the scenario exactly right which is that now you have the Democrats calling for more testimony. Allen Weinstein, who is the chief financial officer --

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: Weisselberg.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.sentences: Weisselberg. And so I think they are going to bring him. if (window && window.foxstrike && Array.isArray(window.foxstrike.cmd)) { window.foxstrike.cmd.push(function(Strike) { Strike.insertAd('desktop', 'lb18', 'desktop-desk-ad-lb18', ''); }); } else { console.error('Error: window.foxstrike not found'); }

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: I don't think he can testify. He has immunity.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.sentences: Well, I think he will be called, Dana. And I think that other people who are in the same orbit in terms of the finances, the deals that were made, the kind of corruption that Cohen suggested was regard to how Trump presented his finances --

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: So now they're investigating the business deals from decades ago?

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.sentences: They will because the door is open.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: OK.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.sentences: But let me just say, the key here to me is forget what Michael Cohen said because you can call him a liar. But you can't forget the documents he produced. He produced documents that showed that as president of the United States while in the office, the president was involved directly in paying off this porn star and that is a crime.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: Personal expenditure. I said that so many times, Juan. if (window && window.foxstrike && Array.isArray(window.foxstrike.cmd)) { window.foxstrike.cmd.push(function(Strike) { Strike.insertAd('desktop', 'lb19', 'desktop-desk-ad-lb19', ''); }); } else { console.error('Error: window.foxstrike not found'); }

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.sentences: You can be the lawyer.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: He would have done it years before --

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Campaign finance, that's what we're talking about.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: Kennedy.

utterances.speaker: MONTGOMERY
utterances.sentences: It's interesting because of couple things. It was very funny when Michael Cohen was asked whether or not he wanted a job in the White House and he said no, absolutely not.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: I think we have it on tape. Can we hear that? Then hear his answer before. if (window && window.foxstrike && Array.isArray(window.foxstrike.cmd)) { window.foxstrike.cmd.push(function(Strike) { Strike.insertAd('desktop', 'lb20', 'desktop-desk-ad-lb20', ''); }); } else { console.error('Error: window.foxstrike not found'); }

utterances.speaker: REP. JIM JORDAN, R-OH
utterances.sentences: You wanted to work in the White House? COHEN: No, sir.

utterances.speaker: JORDAN
utterances.sentences: You didn't get brought to the dance.

utterances.speaker: COHEN
utterances.sentences: I did not want to go to the White House. I was offered jobs.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED MALE
utterances.sentences: Is there a chance?

utterances.speaker: COHEN
utterances.sentences: That he will ask me to go to Washington?

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED MALE
utterances.sentences: There's absolutely a chance he's going to ask you to go. Would you go?

utterances.speaker: COHEN
utterances.sentences: One hundred percent. if (window && window.foxstrike && Array.isArray(window.foxstrike.cmd)) { window.foxstrike.cmd.push(function(Strike) { Strike.insertAd('desktop', 'lb21', 'desktop-desk-ad-lb21', ''); }); } else { console.error('Error: window.foxstrike not found'); }

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: One hundred percent, Kennedy.

utterances.speaker: MONTGOMERY
utterances.sentences: He didn't want to go, absolutely not, and then he said he was so proud of being the personal attorney to the president of the United States. He's proud to be the personal attorney to the president who he has just called a liar, a cheat, and racist. Why would you want to be associated with that person in any capacity because those are three things about someone I certainly wouldn't want to associate myself with.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.sentences: He didn't say that before.

utterances.speaker: MONTGOMERY
utterances.sentences: No.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.sentences: I thought he was saying that he was proud to have been this guy's lawyer for 10 years --

utterances.speaker: MONTGOMERY
utterances.sentences: No, he said that he give me the job in the White House because he was just so proud to be the personal attorney to the president of the United States.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.sentences: He wanted to be, right, right, right. So you're right. He wanted to be. He wanted to continue to be Trump's personal attorney.

utterances.speaker: MONTGOMERY
utterances.sentences: If he knew for years and years, even through his Stockholm syndrome, that the president was so compromised and awful and racist, and now he's willing to come forward and open his heart and shed his tears because his life is ruined, the whole thing is malarkey.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: And now he is a hero. That was a folk hero to Alec Baldwin. I mean, how sad is that?

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.sentences: It looked to me, use the word rat. I think this thing looks so Mafioso-like (ph). I don't like it. I don't like that whole idea. And I do think that somebody who is now going to jail, whose family is being hurt, might have a decision to make about his legacy and maybe that's why he came forward.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: There was no Mafioso stuff (ph) with Chicago and Obama, was it?

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.sentences: No.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: Not at all. They are only trying to sell the Senate seat after he became president.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: Joe Biden and Beto O'Rourke making some big 2020 news. Hear it up next.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.sentences: Some big-name Democrats could be ready to shake up the 2020 race. First, Joe Biden hinting yet again that he could be close to announcing a possible presidential run.

utterances.speaker: JOE BIDEN, FORMER VICE PRESIDENT
utterances.sentences: We just had a family meeting with all the grandkids too, and there is a consensus that I should -- they want -- they, the most important people in my life, want me to run. I don't want this to be a fool's errand. I want to make sure that if we do this and we are very close to getting to a decision, that I am fully prepared to do it. I have not made the final decision but don't be surprised.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.sentences: Beto O'Rourke revealing he's made a decision about 2020. He says he's excited to soon share how he can "best serve our country." O'Rourke also reportedly ruling out another Senate run next year.

utterances.speaker: MONTGOMERY
utterances.sentences: Smart.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.sentences: Kennedy, in fact, the polls show that he would be tied with John Cornyn in a Senate race. You see a lot of the top Democrats right now thinking it would be better if Beto run for Senate. What do you think?

utterances.speaker: MONTGOMERY
utterances.sentences: He definitely got more Senate momentum in Texas and is really well known there. He's laid quite a foundation. He was able to raise so much money. He really could be a threat to Cornyn. I don't disagree with that because when you talk to Democrats and when you talk to independents about Beto O'Rourke, there is no excitement. He is really not an exciting person. Think about what we saw yesterday in North Korea, can you imagine Beto O'Rourke and Kim Jong-un? What kind of conversation they would have? It would be so weird. He's so dorky and awkward. For some reason, he's infuriating to me. He's such a beta male. His nickname Beto is so appropriate because you just swap out an "A" for the "O." He is Beto O'Rourke. I think that he wants to be vice president which is just god-awful. He's probably going to announce with Joe that that is the solid ticket.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.sentences: You think it will be --

utterances.speaker: MONTGOMERY
utterances.sentences: Biden-O'Rourke.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.sentences: Really?

utterances.speaker: MONTGOMERY
utterances.sentences: Very intersectional, yes.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.sentences: Wow. What do you think, Jesse? But Jesse, you know, let's go to Biden for a second because Biden has ran twice before. He says --

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: How did that go?

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.sentences: Not well for him, right? But of course he did win with Obama. But let's just say, he is right now indicating that he's looking at social media for young people.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.sentences: He wants to understand if the support that he's hearing about now is sincere, if it is solid or if it will dissipate once he announces.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: I'm glad you brought that up. This is an actual quote from Joe Biden. He said, "We are taking a hard look at whether or not this alleged appeal I have, how deep does it run? Is it real?" Biden doesn't even know if people like him --

utterances.speaker: MONTGOMERY
utterances.sentences: (INAUDIBLE) on it, right?

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: -- because -- what did they say? Trump called him one percent Biden. The man has no base. He's going to get out there and it's going to just deflate. Remember Rudy Giuliani? High poll numbers in the primary in the 20s and he actually - when the rubber hit the road, it just went right down hill.

utterances.speaker: MONTGOMERY
utterances.sentences: I'm going to wait (ph) till Florida.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: And that's what going to - right, and that's what going to happen to Biden. The minute Biden gets into a debate and Kamala and Pocahontas and Booker, they start sinking their teeth into him, I think he's too clumsy to handle these attacks on identity and he's not going to last. And he should just go out, make money, the Trump economy is strong, and, you know, ride off into the sunset with the nice, decent legacy that he has.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.sentences: Dana, what do you think about his preoccupation at this moment with social media?

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: Well, I think he's actually too preoccupied with what his family thinks about what he should do. I mean, it's like we've been in this family focus group for about two years as his grandchildren want him to run. My grandfather would have been an amazing president as well. Leo Perino, I mean, amazing.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: Wait, how old are his grandchildren by the way?

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: I'm not sure, but the peek-a-boo game from Biden and Beto is tiresome, and I think a couple of things. One, indecision is going to turn off the hard left. If you can't show that you are able, that you have what it takes, you have the fire in the belly to take on Donald Trump and to run against this guy, then you're just not going to get them, but neither of these two need to give themselves any artificial deadlines. If I were Biden, I'd wait. If the most important thing to Democrats is electability, let all these other characters campaign for a few months and lets see if they're actually electable and then get in and try to save the day -

utterances.speaker: MONTGOMERY
utterances.sentences: What about money, though? I mean, I guess that would be the only thing that would force someone's timeline?

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: It might be, but see. The thing about Beto is also a lot of that money came from out of state. I think if he ran for Senate in Texas, it's full scold for Republicans. They always loose. I mean, the Democrats always loose.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.sentences: But you were talking - you were talking about Biden.

utterances.speaker: MONTGOMERY
utterances.sentences: Who?

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.sentences: You. When you talked about money -

utterances.speaker: PREINO
utterances.sentences: For money, for money, yes.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.sentences: - about money.

utterances.speaker: MONTGOMERY
utterances.sentences: No, I was talking about Biden trying to figure out when to get in.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: If I were Beto, I would run now because Joe Biden had a moment to run. It was 2016, he chose not to, and I think maybe the time has passed. But if he would come on the show for the daily briefing -

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.sentences: That'd be great. That'd be great. We suggest you do it, Mr. Vice President. By the way, I think you got to give him a little space on the family stuff because -

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: No, I know. And look, I know anyone to (ph) to suggest that. Look, I understand that of course his son who passed away said last - his dying wish was, "dad, I want you to run," but since then - but the clip we just showed, "my grandchildren think I should run." Like OK, at some point you've got to show that you think you want to run against Trump because you want to run for the country, not because your grandchildren want you to.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.sentences: So Greg, I want you to take on Kennedy because Kennedy is putting down Beto O'Rourke a beta male.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: I will - I want to talk about Beto and Biden. First, every time is see, Beto is not exciting. He's excitable.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Every time I see him I think of a buzz -

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: With his arms?

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Yes, he's like a buzzed college kid at Thanksgiving dinner excitedly telling the family about that class he's taking on gnome tromski (ph), and when he leaves, everybody at the tables going, "did he take something in the bathroom because he's really, really hyped up."

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Biden is like a redhead at the beach. He's got no base, and if he - why enter a race when you're going to have to leave because I feel like the media has already selected Kamala Harris. He's like the old white guy at the rave and people just want him to leave so they can break out the ecstasy. The only way Biden can win - and I believe this seriously and he could win big - is to go talk to the Obamas and convince Michelle to be his VP.

utterances.speaker: MONTGOMERY
utterances.sentences: Interesting.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Then for four years he's got Michelle as VP, he steps aside, then you get eight years of Michelle Obama. 12 years of the Obamas. That's what you do, and I expect my check from the DNC tomorrow.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: Twitter is going to be lit.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Don't you think that's -

utterances.speaker: MONTGOMERY
utterances.sentences: Pretty interesting.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: - what you do?

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.sentences: I think Beto O'Rourke might the vice presidential on the ticket with Biden, but I don't know.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Two white guys?

utterances.speaker: MONTGOMERY
utterances.sentences: See, I think that's the package deal.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Two white guys?

utterances.speaker: MONTGOMERY
utterances.sentences: They can't help themselves. Everyone wants to be president -

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: I don't think they can do two white guys. I just don't think they can.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.sentences: Well, I just think that the key here is for Democrats is beating Trump.

utterances.speaker: MONTGOMERY
utterances.sentences: Well, at least one -

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.sentences: Kamala Harris creating a new controversy. This is an interesting one. Find out about it next on The Five.

utterances.speaker: MONTGOMERY
utterances.sentences: Kamala, are you OK? Kamala Harris sparking a new debate on whether sex work should be decriminalized. The 2020 democratic candidate saying she now supports the idea. How convenient. Watch.

utterances.speaker: SEN. KAMALA HARRIS, D-CALIF.
utterances.sentences: I do. There is an ecosystem around that that includes crimes that are - that harm people, and for those issues, I do not believe that anybody who hurts another human being or profits off of their exploitation should be free of criminal prosecution, but when you're talking about consenting adults I think that - you know, yes. We should really consider that we can't criminalize consensual behavior.

utterances.speaker: MONTGOMERY
utterances.sentences: Oh, how big of you. Well, she's being accused of hypocrisy for those comments given her record as a prosecutor and in 2008 when they were talking about decriminalizing sex work in the great city of San Francisco she said, "I don't want a bunch of pimps and prostitutes coming here," and was instrumental in shutting down backpage.com where sex workers were able to screen perspective clients. Dana -

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: Well, I was just going to say that when you're a prosecutor, though, your job is to prosecute whatever the laws are. So as - you could have a -

utterances.speaker: MONTGOMERY
utterances.sentences: There are a lot of laws.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: There are a lot of laws, but that's the thing and you're -

utterances.speaker: MONTGOMERY
utterances.sentences: And there's a lot of discretion, especially in the -

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: - allowed to change your mind.

utterances.speaker: MONTGOMERY
utterances.sentences: - state of California.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: But if somebody changes their mind and you're for it, should you just say, "great"?

utterances.speaker: MONTGOMERY
utterances.sentences: No, because I worry they're going to change their minds back to something that I despise out of convenience and political opportunity. She said -

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: (inaudible)

utterances.speaker: MONTGOMERY
utterances.sentences: - the same thing with cannabis, and there are a lot of people rotting in prison in California because of some of the decisions that she made as a district attorney and attorney general, and now she's conveniently saying, "well, you know, if it's consenting, if it's consensual transaction between adults," I don't think she believes that. Greg, where do you stand on all of this?

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: She's running on pot and hookers, and I think that's awesome. I'm with Dana. I think if somebody changes their mind, I wills support them. You know, Van Jones created a stir a CPAC for telling conservatives they deserve credit for prison reform. So I do have to say that she deserves credit for, I don't know what you call legalizing sex work. I do believe transactions - I don't have to convince you. Transactions between consenting adults in which both parties agree to the rules is - how can that be subject to prison? How can you go to jail for that blows my mind. People will say, "well, what about trafficking?" Well, prosecute that. You'll do a better job if you focus on trafficking and leave the professionals and the customers out of your way because like the stuff about Backpage and what are Craigslist, a lot of this stuff these are people making deals. They're like -

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: Well, a lot of Backpage stuff was trafficking. If you -

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: I wouldn't know, Dana.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: Well, I covered it as a story. That's how I know.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Oh, you covered it?

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: All right.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: Ask Senator Rob Portman.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Why? Was he on Backpage?

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: No, he was part of the - no, he was part of the - he pushed to get it closed down because of the human trafficking issues, but I think that you're right. I think the human trafficking part, if you want to really focus on that, if you take the other part of that, you would have actually more resources.

utterances.speaker: MONTGOMERY
utterances.sentences: But then you create an even darker black market, and that's the problem because when you force things deeper and deeper in to the shadows and you further criminalize this activity, the black market grows. That's not a good thing, Juan.

utterances.speaker: WILLAIMS
utterances.sentences: I'm not sure -

utterances.speaker: MONTGOMERY
utterances.sentences: Look, people are going to do what they're going to do, and -

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.sentences: Look, I was -

utterances.speaker: MONTGOMERY
utterances.sentences: - you're not going to affect the demand because it's the world's oldest profession because the demand is there.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.sentences: Yes, but I think the violence and the kind of threats and the abuse and the larger sex trafficking we saw in the Bob Kraft case in Florida -

utterances.speaker: MONTGOMERY
utterances.sentences: Allegedly.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.sentences: - I think - yes, and I think - but I think that's what we've got to go after. So I was struck today to see the New York Daily News here in New York come out and say, "yes, we agree with Kamala Harris. We think it's time that you take away the violence, you take away the intimidation, you take this out of the dark entity (ph), and allow people who are of a consensual bond to do what they want to do but then go after the people who are setting up the deals." That to me makes sense. I think it's a waste of our resources to go after what you just described as the oldest profession in the world.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: I think she forgets she's running for President of the United States of America and not California. Look at these radical positions she taking. utterances.speaker: GREG GUTFELD, HOST
utterances.utterance: I am Greg Gutfeld with Kennedy, Juan Williams, Jesse Watters, and she paddleboards on a popsicle stick, Dana Perino, "The Five."

utterances.speaker: DONALD TRUMP, PRESIDENT
utterances.utterance: Always have to be prepared to walk. I could've signed an agreement today in the new people would've said, oh, what a terrible deal, what a terrible thing he did. You have to be prepared to walk. You know, there was a potential we could've signed something today. I could've 100 percent signed something today. We actually have papers ready to be signed but it just wasn't appropriate. I want to do it right. I much rather do it right than do it fast. They wanted to denuke certain areas and I wanted everything. The sanctions are there. I didn't want to give up the sanctions unless we had a real program. They are not ready for that and I understand that fully. I really do. I mean, they spent a lot of time building it and that doesn't mean the world has to be happy. But I want them to denuke.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED MALE (voice-over)
utterances.utterance: Chairman Kim, are you ready to denuclearize?

utterances.speaker: KIM JONG-UN, SUPREME LEADER OF NORTH KOREA (through translator)
utterances.utterance: If I'm not willing to do that, I won't be here right now.

utterances.speaker: TRUMP
utterances.utterance: That might be the best answer you've ever heard.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: All right. So, how do you know when the media roots for failure? When they spend days saying Trump will give away the farm then mock him when he doesn't.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED FEMALE
utterances.utterance: The surprise ending to this very Trumpian cliffhanger is nothing.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED MALE (voice-over)
utterances.utterance: This is the second time the United States has lost in Vietnam.

utterances.speaker: JIM ACOSTA, CNN SENIOR WHITE HOUSE CORRESPONDENT
utterances.utterance: Strike one in Singapore. He didn't a deal with Kim Jong-un. Now, it's strike two in Hanoi. Once again, no deal to denuclearize North Korea, something that he staked a lot of his legacy, a lot of his presidency on.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: So Trump left without a deal. Now, if you believe that this is A, a sign of failure, B, represents the whole process, then C, you flunk this quiz. The fact is walking away is part of the process which is slow and odd. Sometimes it's better to appear going backwards or making nice even when it looks really bad. But the lines of communication exist even when they are crossed. So by walking away a part of negotiating, we actually move ahead. Trump went there, told the guy, hey, the sanctions stay. That's the first and that's progress. And it could be that North Korea is unsolvable. But if there's a solution, it involves talking. And I don't know about you but I feel safer than I did a year ago because of talking. Remember Hawaii? If you still believe that we conceded a lot with just a meeting, then you are a relic, preferring to settle things through the currency of corpses, meaning war, old people throwing bodies at each other. For you, blood is an endless commodity. But for the more peaceful types, we will see what happens. It was a daring alternative to the status quo which is having bureaucrats in Hawaiian shirts telling your family to seek shelter. So this is going to take a while. It's long-term effort with short-term pain. The long-term benefit will bring peace. The short-term pain is the media who screws the world over by making any deal look like a concession. In short, Trump has a long game which is better than the media which has no game at all. Jesse, the media is gloating even though they make the world less safe.

utterances.speaker: JESSE WATTERS, HOST
utterances.utterance: Yeah. You shouldn't be celebrating the fact that North Korea still has missiles pointed at us. It's very hard problem. If it was easy, the last three presidents would've solved it.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Yes.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: I don't like the way they set him up. They said he was going to go over there and sign a bad deal to distract from Cohen. So he goes over there, doesn't sign a better deal, and now they are saying he can't deal. I think what happened was –

utterances.speaker: DANA PERINO, HOST
utterances.utterance: But he did distract from Cohen.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: Yes, he did.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: Yes, he did. And we will have Cohen next (INAUDIBLE).

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: It could be (INAUDIBLE) at any time.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: Honestly, I think what happened was is the Chinese probably told Kim to scuttle this thing, to use this as leverage for the trade deal because remember, Trump said he was going to drop the tariff increase on March 1st. So it's a big kind of gamesmanship between Xi and Trump. Like you said, we will see what happens. I don't like the deal at all. They wanted to destroy their main nuclear plant in exchange for dropping all sanctions. That's crazy. It's an obvious phrase. No deal is better than a bad deal. It's very easy to do a deal. And I think the media likes the idea of a deal and they don't care what's in it. It was easy to make the Iran deal. Just give them a bunch of cash and let them keep all their missiles. I mean, it's easy to do deals. It's very difficult to do tough deals and this is a long-term problem.

utterances.utterance: Yeah.

utterances.utterance: Yeah.
